project_description: A simple Flutter application using the Cubit pattern for state management. The app consists of a login screen and a home screen with a logout button.
architecture_overview: The application follows a modular architecture with separation of concerns. The lib directory contains folders for screens, cubits, models, and widgets. State management is handled using the Cubit pattern from the flutter_bloc package.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant LoginScreen
participant AuthCubit
participant HomeScreen
User -> LoginScreen : enter email and password
LoginScreen -> AuthCubit : login(email, password)
AuthCubit -> LoginScreen : emit Authenticated
LoginScreen -> HomeScreen : navigate to HomeScreen
User -> HomeScreen : click logout
HomeScreen -> AuthCubit : logout()
AuthCubit -> HomeScreen : emit Unauthenticated
HomeScreen -> LoginScreen : navigate to LoginScreen
@enduml
state_management_flow: The AuthCubit is responsible for managing the authentication state. The login method handles user login and emits an Authenticated state, while the logout method handles user logout and emits an Unauthenticated state. The LoginScreen listens to the AuthCubit state and navigates to the HomeScreen upon successful login. The HomeScreen listens to the AuthCubit state and navigates back to the LoginScreen upon logout.
navigation_flow: The app starts with the LoginScreen. Upon successful login, the user is navigated to the HomeScreen. From the HomeScreen, the user can logout which will navigate them back to the LoginScreen.
